title: Kids YouTube Videos Hub: Play embeddable videos on-site, otherwise redirect to YouTube

requirements.text: Update `frontend/src/pages/VideoHubPage.tsx` so that selecting a channel plays videos directly on the website when the channel is marked as allowed to embed, and otherwise prompts the user to watch on YouTube for channels marked as embed-blocked.

quotes: Make focused changes. No other CRUD or features to be changed. **Kids YouTube Videos Hub**- Show video on my website that are not having any copyrights. Rest can be shown via youtube channel.

acceptanceCriteria: For a channel where `embedBlocked` is `true`, the channel detail view does not render an embedded player and instead shows the existing CTA to open the `channelUrl` on YouTube.

For a channel where `embedBlocked` is not `true`, the channel detail view renders an on-site embedded player using that channelâ€™s existing `embedUrl` (e.g., an `<iframe>` within the existing `aspect-video` container).

The embedded player includes appropriate iframe attributes for video playback (e.g., `allow` for autoplay/encrypted-media/fullscreen as needed) and uses the existing `youtube-nocookie.com` embed URLs already present in the channel data.
A visible "Watch on YouTube" button/link remains available in the channel detail view regardless of embed status, using the existing `channelUrl` and opening in a new tab.
No other pages, navigation, CRUD flows, or backend code are changed.

constraints: Make focused changes only for the Kids YouTube Videos Hub; do not change any other CRUD or features.
Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or other immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Backend must remain single-actor; no backend changes are required for this request.
nonGoals: Do not implement automatic copyright detection or any API-based copyright checks.
Do not add video upload/hosting features or store video metadata in the backend.
Do not change the Art Gallery, Admin Dashboard, or any unrelated modules.
